description.narrative: Through the Girls’ Education Challenge (GEC) Fund, DFID is financing projects that will enable approximately 660,000 marginalised girls to complete a full six year cycle of primary school, or approximately one million marginalised girls to complete three years of secondary school. The fund has three distinct funding windows. We are working across all the funding windows and with all grantees across 18 countries. We are evaluating the impact and effectiveness of the funded projects, evaluating the impact of the fund and filling a knowledge gap on what works and what doesn’t in girls’ education in different contexts. We are using a variety of evaluation methods, including randomised control trials, matching methods and longitudinal surveys. We are helping grantees develop customised M&E systems that best meet the needs of their particular projects. A mixed-methods survey at baseline is occurring simultaneously in nine countries. This will be repeated during the fund’s mid-point and end-point For the baseline we are doing 810 qualitative in-depth interviews and 6000 quantitative surveys. This is one of the biggest evaluations DFID has ever commissioned.;
